meanings.definition: A print made by a process in which an image is painted on a smooth surface and transferred to paper.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful monotype of a flower.
meanings.sent2: I bought a monotype of a landscape to hang in my living room.
meanings.sent3: The monotype of a cat looked so realistic, it almost seemed to purr.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a monotype, perfectly captured in that moment.
meanings.sent5: The monotype of the sunset was so vivid, it felt like I could touch the colors.

meanings.definition: A single print made from a monotype.
meanings.sent1: She carefully framed the monotype to display in the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The monotype was a unique piece of art, unlike any other print.
meanings.sent3: The monotype seemed to wink mischievously from the wall.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a monotype, leaving a lasting impression on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The monotype stood out among the other prints, drawing all eyes to its detail.
